definition[0]: at or near the back of something, especially a vehicle
example[0]: the rear door of the car
definition[1]: the part of your body which you sit on
definition[2]: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown
example[2]: Itâ€™s a good place to rear young children.
example[3]: The birds have been successfully reared in captivity.
definition[3]: if an animal rears, it rises up to stand on its back legs
example[4]: The horse reared and threw me off.
definition[4]: if something rears up, it appears in front of you and often seems to be leaning over you in a threatening way
example[5]: A large rock, almost 200 feet high, reared up in front of them.
